column4: hey im trying to compile a new 2.6.16 kernel from kernel.org in ubuntu 9.04 im having some problems can anyone help?
i thought that was a new kernel? gnea?
What's the newest kernel for ubuntu?
try using ./ at the start of the file and use tab completion
you can then move it with GUI
there is no one best kernel
the kernel you have via updates is known to be good and steady, depends what you mean by best
none are better or best, or we'd all use it
best is an opinion so can never be concrete
there are hundreds of distros other than those 3
try it, see how you like it
its the arch of te OS that dictates what you install
you need to look at wat your cpu is, you will be able to run 32bit on both 64 and 32bit CPUs, 32bit is limited to about 3GbR RAM
its offtopic here, this is support
